ships.title: Fleet Management
ships.subtitle: Manage ships for {{company}}.
ships.search_placeholder: Search ships by name, code, operator...
ships.edit_subtitle: Update ship details or manage cabins.

onboard.title: Onboard & ShoreX
onboard.subtitle: Manage ship restaurants, onboard capabilities, and shore excursions (port + duration + pricing).
onboard.no_company: No company selected. Please select a company and sign in again.

restaurants.title: Restaurants
restaurants.subtitle: Create dining venues and optionally tag them with capability codes.

shorex.title: Shore excursions (ShoreX)
shorex.subtitle: Port + duration + capability tags. Add a starting price on create (optional).
shorex.confirm_delete: Delete this shore excursion (and its prices)?

pricing.title: ShoreX pricing
pricing.subtitle: Upsert per (currency, paxtype). This is where duration↔port pricing lives, since each ShoreX is tied to a port + duration.

pricing_page.title: Pricing & Offers
pricing_page.subtitle: Manage pricing categories and cruise price tables.

cruise.title: Cruise pricing table
cruise.subtitle: Pick a sailing (cruise). Rows are cabin categories; columns are active price categories. Enter per-person price in cents. Export JSON/CSV/Excel uses authenticated downloads.
cruise.empty: Load a sailing to view cabin categories and pricing.
cruise.no_active_cats: Create at least one active price category.
cruise.load_first: Load the table first (and ensure at least one active price category).

reports.title: Reporting & Analytics (Snapshot)
reports.subtitle: This starter repo doesn’t include a dedicated analytics service yet; this page provides a high-signal operational snapshot using existing Edge endpoints (notifications + inventory + sailings).

panel_sales.title: Sales activity (from events)
panel_sales.subtitle: Counts derived from booking.held / booking.confirmed events (in-app notifications).
panel_sales.note: For agent/team performance and booking trend charts, add an analytics projection service (or data warehouse) and extend Edge with aggregated endpoints.

panel_inventory.title: Inventory snapshot
panel_inventory.subtitle: Select a sailing to see capacity vs held/confirmed by cabin type.

panel_notifications.title: Recent notifications
panel_notifications.subtitle: A quick feed of operational events (hold/confirm).

notifications.title: Agenda & Notifications
notifications.subtitle: In-app notifications are derived from domain events (holds, confirmations). Tasks are personal and stored locally (demo) — swap this to a real task service when ready.

feed.title: Notifications feed
feed.subtitle: Filter by customer_id if you’re working a specific case.

expiring.title: Expiring holds
expiring.subtitle: These are the most time-sensitive items in your queue.

tasks.title: My tasks
tasks.subtitle: Fast, call-center style: create follow-ups and mark done.
tasks.filter_hint: (Filtering is easy to add once tasks are server-backed.)

users.title: Users & Permissions
users.subtitle: Admin-only. Manage users, groups, and permissions. Tip: tenant admins now automatically get full access even without group membership (avoids setup lockouts).

create_user.title: Create user
create_user.note_groups: Optional: assign groups now (recommended for agents/staff).
create_user.no_groups: No groups yet — create one below.

users_list.title: Users
users_list.note_edit: Notes: email changes are not supported yet; use Disable for reversible lock, Delete for permanent removal.
users_list.confirm_delete:
Delete user "{{email}}"?

group_assignments.title: Group assignments
group_assignments.subtitle: Tick users into groups. Changes apply on next login.

audit.title: Audit log
audit.subtitle: Tenant-scoped audit trail for staff actions (create/patch customers, users, groups, memberships). Admin-only.

filters.title: Filters
filters.subtitle: Use filters to narrow down to a specific agent or entity.

events.title: Events ({{count}})
events.subtitle: Meta includes request + before/after diffs for tracked entities.

company_settings.title: Branding & localization
company_settings.subtitle: White-label settings for this company: logo, theme colors, background image, and supported locales/currencies (no code changes required).

branding.title: Branding
branding.subtitle: These values are used by the portal UI and (next) email templates.
branding.hint_primary: Used for primary buttons and active nav states.
branding.hint_secondary: Used for accents and links (where applicable).

localization.title: Localization
localization.subtitle: Supported languages & currencies for multi-market operations.
localization.hint_locales: This enables multi-language content editing and UI language switching.
localization.hint_currencies: Used for quotes/booking and for formatting.
localization.note: Saved settings are stored per company and are applied instantly in the UI. Next step is to use these values for localized master data (ports/cabins/tours/etc.) and outbound email templates.

theme.title: Portal theme (UI)
theme.subtitle: Create named themes (Light/Dark + custom) and control portal colors. Background image (above) will override the shell background color when set.
theme.note_builtin: Built-in themes are read-only; create a copy to customize.
theme.note_save: Tip: use “Save” in the page header to persist this theme for the company.
theme.msg_builtin_readonly: Built-in themes can’t be edited directly. Create a new theme above to customize all portal colors.
